IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Southern New Hampshire University trains intellectually and culturally enriched individuals.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Universities educational philosophy challenges students intellectual potential and prepares them for professional lives in an ever-changing and increasingly interconnected world. It provides supportive and close knit learning community, delivers engaging instruction in a flexible variety of formats. Students develope the knowledge to understand a complex world, the skills to act effectively, and to make good choices.
IRS990.Description: Financial Aid - Awards all aid to students.

Activity2.Description: School of Business - Teaches all students in the business curriculm

Activity3.Description: Online division - Teaches all students in online environment

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The art collection supports the University curricula and provides a source of emjoyment, enlightenment, and beauty for all who visit the art gallery.

Uncertain Tax Positions The University accounts for the effect of any uncertain tax positions based on a "more likely than not" threshold to the recognition of the tax positions being sustained based on the technical merits of the position under scrutiny by the applicable taxing authority. If a tax position or positions are deemed to result in uncertainties of those positions, the unrecognized tax benefit is estimated based on a "cumulative probability assessment" that aggregates the estimated tax liability for all uncertain tax positions. The University has identified its tax status as a tax-exempt entity as a tax position; however, the University has determined that such tax position does not result in an uncertainty requiring recognition. The University is not currently under examination by any taxing jurisdictions. The University's Federal and state tax returns are generally open for examination for three years following the date filed

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The Universities racially nondiscrimination policy statement is posted in course catalogs as well as on course syllabi, the University website, and bulletin boards in administrative offices.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The University recieves funding from the Department of Education

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: SNHUs office of foundation and corporate relations monitors use of all grant funds. The accounting/finance office monitors all grant revenues and expenditures.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SNHUs office of foundation and corporate relations monitors use of all grant funds. The accounting/finance office monitors all grant revenues and expenditures.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Paul LeBlanc received a housing allowance of $36,000 included in reportable compensation. Lawn care and snow removal provided for home. Tax gross up on tuition benefit. William McGarry received a housing allowance of $31,000 included in reportable compensation. Tax gross up on housing allowance.

Paul LeBlanc received a housing allowance of $36,000 included in reportable compensation. Lawn care and snow removal are provided for his home. Tax gross up on tuition benefits. William McGarry received a housing allowance of $31,000 included in reportable compensation. Tax gross up on housing allowance.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: See From 990 Schedule L Part V

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Draft of From 990 presented to Audit Committee of the Board of Trustees at a regular committee meeting for their review and approval. Then, prior to filing, the Form 990 was provided to all members of the governing body at a regular meeting for approval.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: According to University policy, as set forth in its' bylaws, Trustees, Officers, and Employees are required to infrom the University of business associations of the individual and family members. It requires compliance with NH RSA 7:19-A, The precuniary benefit statute, which requires disclosure, vote without the affective person present, and publication under certain circumstances, with additional reporting to the State of NH Department of Justice, Office of Charitable Trusts, of approved pecuniary benefit transactions found to be in the best interest of the University. Conflicts of Interest are prohibited. Information is monitored consistently, and updated on an annual basis.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All Officer and Key Employee salaries are discussed at a Trustee compensation committee with data to help them determine amounts.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University will consider requests to provide financial statements, conflict of interest policy, and governing documents to the public.
